segments.text: Looking into this kitchen, everything seems so ordinary at first glance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's apron and dress make her look like a classic homemaker.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I notice the faucet running full blast into that sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why hasn't she turned it off? It's flooding everywhere!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's cascading over the edge, soaking the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids—those little rascals are climbing on a stool to raid the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks ready to topple any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's just standing there, hand out, waiting like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is going to end in tears or a broken bone, I just know it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stacked up, towel bunched in her hand—she's oblivious to it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a mess they're making, inside and out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a nice garden, but inside it's chaos waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe no one's paying attention to the dangers.
segments.speaker: PAR
